description: Probably from the stem of Latin clamatus  +‎ -ory; equivalent to claim +‎ -atory. Compare exclamatory, declamatory, reclamatory.

entries.meaning: (rare) Crying out, calling out; claiming, demanding.
examples: Some persons say that it [the "clivia"] was a clamatory, others, again, that it was a prohibitory, bird. We also find a bird mentioned by Nigidius as the “subis," which breaks the eggs of the eagle.
